I don't have access to the latest data regarding environmental pollution in xiamen. however, based on the data available online, the main sources of air pollution in xiamen are industrial emissions, transportation activities, and construction activities. in addition, the burning of fossil fuels (such as coal and oil) and the use of chemical fertilizers and pesticides in agriculture can also contribute to air pollution.

water pollution in xiamen can be caused by industrial and domestic wastewater discharges, agricultural practices that involve the use of chemical fertilizers and pesticides, and oil spills from ships and boats. soil pollution in xiamen can be caused by industrial activities that involve the use of chemicals, the dumping of waste materials in landfills, and agricultural practices that involve the use of chemical fertilizers and pesticides.

the impact of pollution on health and the environment in xiamen is significant. exposure to air pollution has been linked to respiratory diseases, heart diseases, and cancer. water pollution can harm aquatic life and affect human health if polluted water is used for drinking, swimming, or other recreational activities. soil pollution can lead to the loss of soil fertility, contamination of groundwater, and accumulation of toxins in crops that can affect human health. therefore, the government and the public need to take measures to control pollution and protect the environment and public health in xiamen.
